ccre.holders

Class AbstractFloatTuner

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.holders.AbstractFloatTuner
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    FloatInput, FloatInputPoll, FloatInputProducer, FloatOutput, FloatTuner

    public abstract class AbstractFloatTuner
extends java.lang.Object
implements FloatTuner
    An AbstractFloatTuner is an abstract class that allows for easy implementation of a FloatTuner.

      • notifyConsumers

        protected void notifyConsumers()

      • readValue

        public float readValue()
        Description copied from interface: FloatInputPoll
        Get the current state of this float input. By convention, most float inputs and outputs have states that range from -1.0f to 1.0f.
        Specified by:
        readValue in interface FloatInputPoll
        Returns:
        The current value.

      • addTarget

        public void addTarget(FloatOutput output)
        Description copied from interface: FloatInputProducer
        Subscribe to changes in this float input's value. The float output will be modified whenever the value of this input changes. By convention, most float inputs and outputs have states that range from -1.0f to 1.0f. If available, the current value of the input will be written at this time.
        Specified by:
        addTarget in interface FloatInputProducer
        Parameters:
        output - The float output to notify when the value changes.
        See Also:
        FloatOutput.writeValue(float), FloatInputProducer.removeTarget(ccre.chan.FloatOutput)

      • removeTarget

        public boolean removeTarget(FloatOutput output)
        Description copied from interface: FloatInputProducer
        Unsubscribe from changes in this float input's value. This reverses the actions of a previous addTarget call. By convention, most float inputs and outputs have states that range from -1.0f to 1.0f.
        Specified by:
        removeTarget in interface FloatInputProducer
        Parameters:
        output - The output to unsubscribe.
        Returns:
        Whether the output was actually subscribed.
        See Also:
        FloatInputProducer.addTarget(ccre.chan.FloatOutput)

      • writeValue

        public void writeValue(float newValue)
        Description copied from interface: FloatOutput
        Set the float value of this output. By convention, most float inputs and outputs have states that range from -1.0f to 1.0f.
        Specified by:
        writeValue in interface FloatOutput
        Parameters:
        newValue - The new value to send to this output.
